EXO EXPLORER

We calculate the SNR of each planet using the following $$ \text{SNR}=\text{SNR}_0\left[\frac{R^*R_P(D/6)}{(E_S/10)*P_S}\right]^2 $$
Where $R^*$ is the stellar-radius with respect to our sun, $R_P$ is the planetary radius relative to Earth, $P_S$ is the planet-star distance in AU, $E_S$ is the distance to the planetary system in parsecs, and the diameter of the telescope (in meters) is $D$. We assume that $\text{SNR}_0=100$ and filter for all planets with $\text{SNR}>5$.
We also filter for the capability to separate the exoplanet from its host star. This is done by filtering for planets that satisfy the following condition $$ E_S > E_{S\text{max}} = 15 \frac{D/6}{P_S} $$

Telescope diameter: 5 m
